definition: hard to explain in a few words (idiom); complicated and not easy to express succinctly
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
words/speech/to say/to talk
difficult (to...)/problem/difficulty/difficult/not good
disaster/distress/to scold
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
to the greatest extent/(when used before a noun of location) furthest or extreme/to be within the limits of/to give priority to

sentences.english: How am I doing? Well sometimes it's hard to tell.
sentences.chinese: 我生活得怎样？有时真是一言难尽。

sentences.english: The desperation of the infertile would-be mother knows no bounds.
sentences.chinese: 那些不能生育的准妈妈们的绝望是一言难尽的。

sentences.english: Feminism's fine, but there's a lot to be said for having your bills paid.
sentences.chinese: 女权固然光彩，然而要用你的钱，真是一言难尽。

sentences.english: Talking about it is you really untold.
sentences.chinese: 说起它呀，真是一言难尽。

sentences.english: I want to say so much, but I can hardly find the words.
sentences.chinese: 我想说的有很多，但我真的一言难尽。

sentences.english: The English spelling system is 'absolutely, unspeakably awful'.
sentences.chinese: 英文拼写系统“真是一言难尽的糟糕”。

sentences.english: 'English has an absolutely, unspeakably awful spelling system, ' said Bell, a former English teacher and author of the book Understanding English Spelling.
sentences.chinese: 英语这个语言的拼写系统真是一言难尽的糟糕。

sentences.english: It's a long story. I'm afraid I can't tell you.
sentences.chinese: 真是一言难尽，恐怕我不能告诉你。

sentences.english: The story roots in a long story.
sentences.chinese: 这个故事的起源一言难尽。

definition: indeed/truly/(coll.) (used to express disapproval, annoyance etc about sth)
hey!/(interjection used to attract attention or to express surprise or disapprobation)
interjection or grunt of agreement/uhm/Ah, OK/expression of recognition/Oh, it's you!
modal particle ending sentence, showing affirmation, approval, or consent
interjection of surprise/Ah!/Oh!
interjection expressing doubt or requiring answer/Eh?/what?
interjection of surprise or doubt/Eh?/My!/what's up?
to be underwhelmed/to be less than impressed
sentence-final particle (abbr. for 呢啊[ne5 a5] or variant of 哪[na5])
battle cry
a little
vexed/annoyed/upset
returning to our main topic,.../that said,.../again,.../in this connection/in passing/nevertheless,.../anyhow
to speak the truth/truth to tell/frankly
(coll.) nobody can beat that/extraordinary/remarkable
(of an actor) to disengage from the performance (e.g. after the show ends)/(of an audience) to lose interest in the performance
awkward/embarrassed
(coll.) to look alike/to be a spitting image of
slightly/a little/somewhat
really/actually/indeed/true/real/honest/dependable/(philosophy) reality
(onom.) to sigh/to sob
